candidates.title: Photo has been edited to show Trumps parents wearing KKK robes
candidates.content:
CLAIM: Picture shows Mary and Fred Trump, wearing Ku Klux Klan robes, standing with son Donald Trump in 1999.
APS ASSESSMENT: False. The photo, which was taken of Trump with his parents in 1992, has been altered.
THE FACTS: The manipulated photo, edited to make it appear Trumps parents are wearing Klan garb, has circulated before on social media. It surfaced again this week on Facebook and Twitter.
The original photo was taken by Judie Burstein in 1992, according to Globe Photos, a celebrity and entertainment photo company that archived the image in March 2004.
The image shows Trump in a red tie and a black suit standing with his arms wrapped around his mother and father. Mary Trump is wearing a pink and black floral suit, with pearls draped around her neck. Fred Trump is wearing a navy suit, red pocket square and polka dot tie. The three Trumps posed for the photo against a marble wall backdrop and a sign that reads theater tickets.
Trump followed his father into the real estate business. Fred Trump, who made a fortune in real estate, died in 1999 at the age of 93. Mary Trump died in 2000, at the age of 88.
___
This is part of The Associated Press ongoing effort to fact-check misinformation that is shared widely online, including work with Facebook to identify and reduce the circulation of false stories on the platform.
Heres more information on Facebooks fact-checking program: https://www.facebook.com/help/1952307158131536

candidates.title: Donald Trump's Parents Wore Ku Klux Klan Attire?
candidates.content:
Claim:
A photograph shows Donald Trump posing with his parents in Ku Klux Klan robes.
Rating:
False
About this rating
A photograph purportedly showing Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump standing with his parents after they have donned Ku Klux Klan robes added to the noise as the presidential race heated up in September 2016:
This photograph is not genuine and has been rather clumsily altered from the original, in which all three of them are wearing perfectly normal (and color-cordinated) clothing without a hint of Klan insignia:

final_result.explanation:
The original news caption claims that the photograph shows Donald Trump posing with his parents in Ku Klux Klan robes. Both internal and external validation processes strongly refute this claim.

Internal Validation:
The internal analysis reveals a discrepancy between the caption and the visual content. While the image shows Donald Trump with his mother and another man in robes, the robes do not visually resemble those associated with the Ku Klux Klan. The symbols on the robes are not consistent with known KKK regalia.  The internal check highlights this inconsistency and assigns a low confidence score (2) to the caption's accuracy. The lack of visual elements typically associated with the KKK (pointed hoods, specific cross-burning imagery, etc.) further weakens the claim.

External Validation:
External sources overwhelmingly debunk the claim. Multiple reliable sources confirm that the image is digitally manipulated. These sources provide evidence that the original photograph depicts Trump and his parents in ordinary clothing, without any KKK-related attire. The external validation process gives the caption a very low confidence score (10), firmly rejecting its veracity.  The external evidence provides irrefutable proof of image alteration, directly contradicting the original caption. The high confidence score (10) from the external check reflects the abundance and reliability of sources confirming image manipulation.

Discrepancies and Uncertainties:
There is no significant discrepancy between the internal and external checks. Both processes independently conclude that the caption is inaccurate and misleading. The differences in confidence scores (2 vs. 10) merely reflect the differing levels of evidence available to each process.  Internal validation relies on visual interpretation alone, while external validation leverages multiple external sources providing irrefutable proof. However, both support the conclusion of the caption being factually incorrect.

Visual Evidence Analysis:
Careful examination of the image reveals telltale signs of digital manipulation. The robes appear artificially added to the original photograph, evident through unnatural blending at edges and slight inconsistencies in color and texture compared to the rest of the image.   The visual evidence strongly suggests that the image has been altered to misrepresent reality, creating a misleading narrative.

Conclusion:
Based on comprehensive internal and external validation, the original caption is decisively determined to be out of context (OOC).  The weight of evidence, both visual and from external sources, overwhelmingly demonstrates that the caption is false. The image has been manipulated to falsely represent Trump and his parents in KKK attire. The high confidence score reflects the strength and consistency of evidence supporting this conclusion.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validations strongly reject the original caption's claim. Internal analysis finds the image inconsistent with typical KKK regalia, while external sources definitively prove the image is a digitally altered hoax.  There is no conflict between the internal and external findings, both supporting a verdict of 'out of context'.
